results.title: Learning about air
results.creator_credit: Stelios Roccos, ACI Films and Peter Scheer
results.brief_description: Introduces basic scientific properties of air using simple examples. Shows that air has weight, occupies space and can exert pressure; explains that a combination of a force with air can create energy as in the powering of a windmill. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stelios Roccos, ACI Films and Peter Scheer

results.title: Learning & achievement
results.creator_credit: George A. Colburn, Darrel Schwandt, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
The role that learning plays in the lives of children, the functions of schooling and children’s orientation toward mastery and achievement are addressed as events surrounding the child’s first day of school in Japan, Russia, Brazil and the U.S. are observed. Discusses variables that enhance learning and promote competence.

results.title: Learning
results.creator_credit: Bob Penn, Eve Cote and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
We live in a changing world and our experiences help us to learn how to adapt to these changes. This program looks at the way we learn - at classical and operant conditioning. Classical conditioning which was discovered by Pavlov proposes that we learn by association; that one thing leads to another. Edward Thorndyke and B. F. Skinner developed this further to mean that the consequences of our actions shape our behaviour. Operant conditioning proposes that we learn because of potential rewards and this is demonstrated by the education of hyperactive children in a highly structured environment.

results.title: Learn to swim. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Robert Steele, New Line Cinema, New Zealand. Dept. of Education and Ronald Bowie
results.brief_description: Presented in 3 parts. Part 1 deals with the gaining of confidence and getting used to being in water. Part 2 focuses on general excersises such as foot and leg action whereas part 3 deals entirely with arm action.

results.title: Learn to Ski
results.brief_description: Aimed at the beginner skier and provides comprehensive information on ski equipment and technique. It shows how easy skiing can be, once you know what gear is required, how to select it in the proper size, how to put it on and how to control speed and direction when skiing. It takes you step by step through the equipment and techniques used in both cross country and downhill skiing at resorts.
results.description: Aimed at the beginner skier and provides comprehensive information on ski equipment and technique. It shows how easy skiing can be, once you know what gear is required, how to select it in the proper size, how to put it on and how to control speed and direction when skiing. It takes you step by step through the equipment and techniques used in both cross country and downhill skiing at resorts.

results.title: Learn to ski
results.creator_credit: Peter Jones, ONF | NFB and Ernest Reid
results.brief_description: In skiing, the beginner is wise to learn the right technique at the outset so that he has nothing to unlearn. This film shows the best techniques, as recommended by the Canadian Ski Instructors’ Alliance and the Canadian Amateur Ski Association. Every movement is clearly demonstrated in action and, where necessary, in slow-motion.

results.title: Learn to Relax
results.brief_description: Overviews two relaxation techniques that everybody should know before stress becomes a real problem. This program teaches both progressive relaxation and autogenic relaxation techniques against beautiful natural background music.

results.title: Learn about dinosaurs
results.creator_credit: Guidance Associates, Eve Cotton and M.W. Ebert
results.brief_description: 70 million years ago, the last of the dinosaurs disappeared from the earth. These dinosaurs (“terrible lizards”) ruled the world for over 130 million years. This storybook style program introduces children to the evolution of dinosaurs and their development over four periods - the Triassic, the Jurassic, Cretaceous and the end of the dinosaurs. Young viewers are introduced to the names and terminology used in the study of dinosaurs and all terms are simply explained and illustrated.
